reviews.review_msg: I dont know what planet this guy lives on but lets just say 80% is a C+. End of story. No scaling! THAT'S IT! Besides the unfair marking scheme, he over-complicates the already difficult topics, and dont even bother approaching him to ask questions. Extremely rude. I have to say he is the WORST prof/teacher Ive ever had in my 15 years of education.

his lectures are dry and he speaks in a monotone voice. you have to go to class to understand his notes as they are usually just figures with minimal writing. average was really low. exams were on the harder side. the M/C was tricky, especially the conceptual questions. the grading scale is different as 60% and below is considered a fail.

his lectures are boring, he speaks in terrible monotone, his notes are useless. the average mark in his class is lower D, just above fail, and there were only 4 As among more than 200 people. anyway, if you feel like memorizing half of the textbook for your final exam, go ahead and take him, and let the force be with you.
Knows his stuff but sometimes hard to pay attention to because he's so monotone and unexpressive.  Tests are difficult but do-able.

some ppl complained about him, i can understand why, but although i got an okay mark in the class, he's not a bad prof. he talks really slow.. and kinda takes a long time explaining something, but he wants us to understand. midterms and final were on the hard side.. and marking on it was pretty hard..
No Comments

I didn't enjoy this class at all-- lectures were boring and vague. He got behind in the notes every class and had to compensate by cramming 3 lectures into one condensed lecture which makes for some fun self-teaching later. Also, he said he would scale the course, but my final mark was an A with 93.5% so I don't think he did.

I really disliked the way this professor taught his lectures. He likes to use boldy phrases like: biosynthetic pathway even though we have no clue what he's talking about. He also didn't give many tips on examinations, so you better know your stuff. I did not like his grade scale. Avoid this professor if possible.

This prof was pretty good, if a little arrogant. One glaring fault though- he could not give you a concise, clear answer to a question. Also, if your just got off the boat, you may have trouble understanding his high-level vocab. Exams were definitely fair, and though time was never abundant, if you knew your stuff you'd have plenty of time.
doesn't care if you do well, as long as he likes his own grading system

Exam questions are vague, but ask for specific things,,, how the hell we know what he's asking for? There will only be an A if you have a 90%. Therefore you must have a cumulative mark of 70% and above to pass this course with him.

His grading scale sux.  He talks a lot but he doesnt know how to explain in a way that make ppl understand.   You get a "D" if you get below 70%.  And his exams test you how fast you can write, not how well you understand the material.  I never have time to double check my answers.
absurd grading scale.
This prof can not teach ... he tries but just can't explain anything clearly in one straight forward sentence ... ahh the lecture seems very boring!

Dr. Northwood is an excellent professor. Lectures are engaging and exams are completely fair. She is abundantly clear on what material will be covered on exams and provides good study resources. She has also been very accommodating during the pandemic and is approachable for help.

She is always in a bad mood and brings her problems to class. She does NOT teach. Flipping through 36 slides and reading the headers does not qualify as teaching. Not a fair marker..how does 70 percent translate into a C? And she refused to explain why.

She just wants to yell at students and she ignores everyone. She has a very bad attitude toward the students and her marking is unfare. I don't know why she is still teaching at SFU. She is always late to her classes and skips her office hours. I got good mark in her class but I think taking class with her is totally waste of time.
No Comments
Is she Nice? Depends on her mood. Materials are damn heavy (more than 30 notes per lecture). Is marking fair? Answer: is it fair if i got over 60% and u deserve for a D?
It was her first time teaching MBB, so there was no final, just 4 straight foreward midterms. Very fare and clear on material. Great personality. Lectures were always interesting.

Exams are very fair, but really watch out for the later material cuz the last 2 midterms were somewhat tougher than the first 2.  She's a good lecturer.  If u have to take mbb, try to take it with her! She doesn't scale, so whatever u get is what u get.
She is very clear on what to know (ie what is on the exam). She is a fair marker. Her notes are very organized. She is very enthusiastic about the material. I recommend her for any class :)
